scenarioDescription:
The HD 39194 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 39194 is a star with 0.67 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.78 times its radius. It is located 86.15 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 10 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 39194 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 39194 system


HD 39194 b

HD 39194 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2021-10, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 39194 b is 4.004 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 39194 b is 1.830 that of Earth. At 4.004 Earth masses, HD 39194 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


HD 39194 c

HD 39194 c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2021-10, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 39194 c is 6.303 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 39194 c is 2.390 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 39194 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 39194 d

HD 39194 d was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2021-10, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 39194 d is 4.004 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 39194 d is 1.830 that of Earth. At 4.004 Earth masses, HD 39194 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 39194, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: HD 39194 - System With 3 Exoplanets
